children.subject: Sorry, 54 has 3 lectures. One of them is taught by Teleman, another is taught by Katrin Wehrheim, and the third is Vera Serganova. If anyone has experience with these professors and can comment on the workload/exam and homework difficulty that would be much appreciated!

Took Teleman in Fall 2018. Personally, didn't like his style of lecturing at all, not very organized while lecturing and doesn't provide many examples to apply theorems/concepts. For the linear algebra portion, I mainly relied on the textbook. For DiffEq's, since the text is trash, I mainly relied on GSI (try to get a good GSI if possible). Exams were pretty simple but very computationally heavy. Other than a few T/F questions, almost all of the free responses involve many calculations. If you aren't particularly strong with proofs, I think its easier to do well on Teleman's exams. Also, he has an exam drop policy to drop your lowest midterm score.
For reference, Garcia and Miki Lustig are teaching 61C, Constantin Teleman is teaching 54, and Hug is teaching Data 100 if that helps with figuring out how much of a workload it will be!

history.content:
Hey, 

I was wondering how manageable this class schedule seems. For reference, I don’t know linear algebra, and I haven’t taken data 8, but I’ve take both 61A, B, 70, 170, and 188 (I’m in 170 and 188 right now, so how would this 3 class courseload compare to my current schedule?). I’m going to be a junior, and I also want to have time to spend a some serious time on internship recruiting. Would this schedule be too much work to still have a seriously amount of time to dedicate to recruiting? If it would be too much work, does anyone know any tech electives I would be able to substitute for Data 100 to lower the workload, or should I just stick with other 54 and 61C? I’ll  have to take one semester with with 3 techs, so i was thinking this would be the lightest time to take the 3 before I’m taking all all upper divs. Any advice would be really great!
history.subject: Math 54 + 61C + Data 100
